summary: Nancy P. Schultz was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates. The documents suggest she was a staff member during the later stages of the committee's work.
significance: Nancy P. Schultz's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates she was a staff member involved in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
